synopsis: In episode #6 of Pineapple Blood Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir delve deep into the themes of self-worth and neuroticism, sharing personal stories of growth and emotional struggles. They explore the importance of recognizing one's feelings, the impact of external validation, and the journey toward self-acceptance, all while maintaining a light-hearted and relatable tone.
quotes: The problems and issues that I can't acknowledge scare me more than the ones that I'm dealing with.
It's so much better to finally get a grasp on this stuff after years of feeling like I was holding myself back.
You have to realize the way you're living is an option, and you are free as a human being to modify that at your own will.
Just because we're not consciously thinking about something doesn't mean we aren't assessing the world around us.
I always get frustrated with how long I'm taking to grow when these things take time.
You're literally trying to become someone you have never been before; unique patience is required.
I was so fixated on trying to get everything perfect that I missed the things I love.
You can't ever truly be altruistic unless you're a little egoistic.
Nobody hurts people in isolation; there's a whole story behind every action.
You will never be able to be empathetic towards yourself if you don't give other people the same empathy.
